page.title: 04Chapelthorpe Church_1300
page.content: The earliest mention of Chapelthorpe Church is in 1285, when it was called Schapelthorpe. The earliest building was just one of the chapels of Sandal Magna parish along with the other scattered Hamlets or Thorpes like Painthorpe and Hollingthorpe. The early chapel was 18 metres long and 7 metres wide, it's nave and chancel were under the one roof, and it had the early English style of architecture, it had no tower, the widows were lancets, with probably a three lancet window at the East end . The chancel was raised a single step above the nave floor level, and probably the latter was unpaved and occasionally strewn with rushes. On 19th June 1951 a tragic fire gutted the Church's interior including the main Window. A new Church was erected shortly after.
